Exeter Parents and Guardians:

There are a lot of reasons children might not have health insurance — maybe parents have lost jobs, maybe they don't have health insurance at work, or maybe other options just cost too much. Whatever the reason, the Children’s Health Insurance Program, also known as CHIP, may be able to help.

Visit http://www.chipcoverspakids.com to learn about your child's CHIP eligibility and the benefits under the Children's Health Insurance Program, Pennsylvania's program to provide health insurance to uninsured children and teens who are not eligible for or enrolled in Medical Assistance.

Paper copies of the application and CHIP flyer are also available at the main offices of all campus school buildings and the Lausch Administration Building.

Dear Exeter Township School District Parents and Guardians,

As we prepare to begin the school year virtually, our goal is to ensure that your child is prepared for success. Providing students with resources to support their online learning experience is an important part of our virtual learning plan. Therefore, the District will be creating learning resources for students in Grades K-4. These learning resources will include, but are not limited to, books, math manipulatives, workbooks, and Fundations materials for our K-2 learners. Additionally, we will be distributing devices to families. Exeter Township School District understands that we may have families that do not have internet access; therefore, the District will have hotspots for families in need of this support. More information will be forthcoming regarding the distribution of those items.

Your Partners in Education,

Dr. Christy Haller
Mr. Ted Isselmann
Mrs. Renee Mosser

Dear Exeter Township School District,

I wanted to reach out and let everyone know that May 8, a date currently listed on the District calendar as a Teacher In-Service Day, will no longer be an in-service day and will be a normal instructional day instead. At this time of the year and given the unique circumstances all districts are facing, we felt it was in the best interest of all our students and their learning to make this decision. Please note that this calendar change does increase the number of student days from 180 to 181. That said, we believe that the additional day of instruction will prove beneficial to all students, especially given the uncertain times in which we live. Additionally, please be aware that June 5 is still the last student day of the year.

In closing, we appreciate your ongoing support of your children as we work through virtual learning together, and please join me in thanking all of our teachers for their hard work and dedication today and throughout Teacher Appreciation Week.

Stay safe,

Dr Robert Phillips, Superintendent of Schools

post_text: With students at home now in an eLearning environment, Service Electric Cablevision (SECV) will offer 90 days free Internet service to students and teachers who do not already subscribe to SECV Internet. This offer includes the 40M x 4M tier of Internet service, along with a free cable modem rental. It applies only to new customers that have not subscribed to SECV Internet service within the last sixty (60) days. Self-installation required with the assistance of a technician outside the residence to ensure the safety of our employees. All new customers must provide written proof of their child’s current enrollment at a local school in SECV’s service area. All teachers must reside in SECV’s service area and provide evidence of current employment status. Other restrictions may apply. For more information or to enroll in the eLearning offer, please call 877.955.7328.

We just sent out the last of the hard copy materials to the buildings and they are now available for pick up at your convenience. We will have copies of all hard copy materials to access on our website in the near future. We have also placed many instructional resources that you can access on our website and more are being added daily.

Please know we are constantly communicating with our local, state, and federal agencies and taking every precaution to keep our staff safe and our students supported. Please keep watching the District website for continued updates.

Stay Safe,

Dr. Robert Phillips, Superintendent of Schools

Exeter Township, Berks County, PA
March 13 at 6:40 PM ·

COVID-19 UPDATE: Township officials announced today a preventative plan in an effort to mitigate the spread of the virus in our Township. View the official press release here: https://cms3.revize.com/revize/exetertwp/3-13-20%20COVID-19%20FACEBOOK.pdf

The public is being asked to avoid visiting the Township Administration Building for the next two weeks if possible, especially if you, or someone at home, is exhibiting symptoms. Over the past month, Ms. Seeberger has taught a "Cool Down Lesson" in each classroom. The focus of the lesson was on using tools to help us "Cool Down" when we have big, intense emotions that are distracting us in school. She introduced to the students a cool down box that they will have access to in their classrooms (K will be introduced in the spring!). Each student practiced how to use the tools and consider what works best for them! The lesson finished with a trip to our brand new sensory path in the library hallway! All students K-4 had the chance to go through the pathway and practice using it to help them "Cool Down". Our students experience lots of emotions everyday and we know it is important to teach them about self-regulation and how to advocate for themselves when they need a break. We hope these new tools will benefit our school and allow each student to feel successful at Lorane and we are thankful to our partners at J.P. Mascaro for funding this installation!

Important information

post_text:
Dear Exeter Community,

I am writing to share the sad news that our school community has suffered the tragic death of a student. We do not know many details at this point beyond what can be found in the public media including these local stories from the Reading Eagle and WFMZ. To support our students and staff, counselors will be available at the Senior High School on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday this week from 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM. http://ow.ly/zd9g50vpwLT

Sincerely,

Dr. Robert E. Phillips
Superintendent of Schools
Exeter Township School District
610-898-9569
